org.xbib.elasticsearch.index.analysis.combo

Class CachingTokenStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.lucene.util.AttributeSource
      • org.apache.lucene.analysis.TokenStream
        • org.xbib.elasticsearch.index.analysis.combo.CachingTokenStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public final class CachingTokenStream
extends org.apache.lucene.analysis.TokenStream
    This class can be used if the token attributes of a TokenStream are intended to be consumed more than once. It caches all token attribute states locally in a List.

    CachingTokenStream implements the optional method TokenStream.reset(), which repositions the stream to the first Token.

    It differs from Lucene's CachingTokenFilter in that it creates a new AttributeSource, unrelated to the provided input. This permits free reuse of the TokenStream, and after fillCache() has been called, the underlying input TokenStream is available for garbage collection. CachingTokenFilter has no such feature because it keeps the same AttributeSource and if the source analyzer reuses the TokenStream in a call of Analyzer.tokenStream(String, java.io.Reader), then a call on TokenStream.incrementToken() will affect the current attribute state of the "cached" instance.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Rewinds the iterator to the beginning of the cached list.

        Note that this does not call reset() on the wrapped tokenstream ever, even the first time. You should reset() the inner tokenstream before wrapping it with CachingTokenStream.

        Overrides:
        reset in class org.apache.lucene.analysis.TokenStream
